conversation.content: Good afternoon. I need information about shipping a package to Germany. What international options do you offer?

Good afternoon, and thank you for contacting us. We offer three international shipping tiers to Germany: Express International arrives in 3-5 business days, Standard International takes 7-10 business days, and Economy International requires 14-21 business days.
What are the price differences between these options? The package weighs approximately twelve pounds.

Certainly. For a 12-pound package to Germany, Express International costs $147.50 with tracking code prefix EXP, Standard International is $89.00 with STD prefix, and Economy International is $42.75 with ECO prefix.
Those prices seem reasonable. Can you explain what customs fees I should expect?
Customs fees depend on the declared value and contents. Germany typically charges 19% VAT on items over 22 euros, plus potential duty fees ranging from 2% to 12% based on product category HS codes.
That's quite complex. How do I determine the correct product category for electronics?

I understand your concern. Electronics generally fall under HS code chapter 85, with duty rates between 3.7% and 6%. I can email you our International Shipping Guide PDF-2024-v3 which includes a complete category reference table.
Yes, please send that guide. Also, who handles the customs paperwork on my end?

I'll send that immediately to your email on file. With our Express and Standard services, we provide all required customs forms including the CN22 declaration and commercial invoice, pre-filled based on information you provide through our online portal.
That's helpful. Is there insurance included with any of these shipping options?

Express International includes $100 automatic coverage under policy INT-100-BASE. Standard includes $50, and Economy has no default coverage. Additional insurance is available at $2.50 per $100 of declared value up to $5000 maximum.
I need coverage for fifteen hundred dollars. How much would that additional insurance cost?
Of course.
And that additional insurance cost would be the same regardless of which shipping tier I select?
For $1500 coverage, the additional insurance would be $35.00 for Express since it already includes $100, or $37.50 for Standard and Economy tiers, calculated from their base coverage amounts.
Thank you for clarifying. What happens if German customs rejects or holds the package?

If customs holds your package, you'll receive notification via tracking update and email within 24-48 hours. Our International Support Team, available Monday through Friday 8AM-8PM EST at extension 4500, assists with customs resolution and documentation.
Perfect. I'll take the Express International option with the additional insurance please.

Excellent choice. I've initiated your Express International shipment order EXP-7734521-DE with $1500 insurance coverage, totaling $182.50. You'll receive a confirmation email with prepaid shipping label and customs forms within 15 minutes.
